##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Jacob Langsam Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Jacob Langsam Family




Some background email from the family can be found here.
Jacob Langsam was married to Rivkah and had one known son. 

Phillip (Feivel) (1869 - February 1, 1950), a tailor, married Fanny (1873 - November 5, 1947), daughter of Morris and Yetta Grumet, on December 6, 1896 in Manhattan, NY (cert #19340). They had six known children. Phillip sailed from Hamburg, Germany aboard the Patricia and arrived in NY on July 4, 1887. He was originally from Jaroslaw, Poland. In 1919, when he naturalized, he and his family were living at 1461 St Marks Avenue, Brooklyn, NY. In the 1940 census they lived in Brooklyn at 1445 East 19th Street.
        Rose (Oct 9, 1897 - ?) became a teacher. She married late and had no children.
        Jack (Oct 10, 1899 - ?) worked for his cousin, Paul Fischer. He married Frances Grace "Fanny" Weisglass. There is a marriage record at Dade county in 1939 (Volume:	495, Cert #: 12249). In 1940 they show up in the census as living in Stamford, CT, along with a 10 year old girl, referred to as a daughter, named Marjorie Misel. Perhaps she was from an earlier unknown marriage. 
        Becky died at two years of age.
        Sophie (Feb 11, 1904) married a grocery clerk. She is listed with the family in 1920 on the census, but not in 1925 or 1930. In 1940 she is again listed with her parents, with a divorced status.
        Gertrude (Dec 3, 1907- 1984) married Alvin Udell (1906 - 1987), the son of a well-to-do dress manufacturer (Max Udell & Jane Walcoff), on December 7, 1927 in Brooklyn, NY. They had two known children, both of whom show up on the 1940 census with their parents, living at 18 East 9 Street in Manhattan, along with a maid. Alvin's profession is listed as a clothing executive. Perhaps Alvin and not Max was the dressmaker. 
            Marien & Richard
        Martin (Dec 18, 1911 -  Nov 1984) was a doctor. He married Beatrice "Bea" Lipston on July 22, 1937 in Brooklyn, NY. They had one known daughter. 
            Jean Ellen
        






I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.
Moishe Millermoishe@langsam.com

My home address is
           1374 East 28th Street
           Brooklyn NY 11210-5311
           USA

  
Last updated 11/5/2014

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Naftali Langsam Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Naftali Langsam Family





Naftali Langsam (18? - before 1907) was married to Pesel Blan, daughter of Shlamy and Freida, of Jawornik, Poland. They are not known to have come to the USA. They had five known children.

Rachela  (18? - ?) was married to married Jacob Zucker. They had 5 children. Rachela's children retained her maiden name of Langsam.
        Blima (1895 - ?)
        Benisch (1898 - ?) 
        Markus (1899 - 19?) was  married to Golda Ames in 1936.
        Nathan (born 1908) was married to Esther Teitelbaum (daughter of Morris) of Sieniawa, Poland and had one known daughter. He came to the USA in June 1935 and later naturalized.  
            Florence
        Sheindel (born 1909) was married to Isak Chartner in 1939.
        
   Leya (1882 - before 1923) married Kalman Schmaltz and had 6
known children.
	   boy died as an infant at six weeks of age.
	   Helen
	   Esther
	   Florence married Hyman Bluestein and had children. She came to the USA on Sept 5, 1923 aboard the Canopic sailing out of Danzig. She was travelling with two sisters, listed as Chaja and Sara. They came from an orphange in Hucisko (near Jawornik). Their last residence before leaving was an uncle, Leib Schmalz. Upon arrival they went to their maternal uncle, Harry Bessen (42 Webster Ridge, New Rochelle, NY). Florence related that their great-aunt, Feiga Feit (see H8 section) of St. Louis, travelled to Warsaw to arange for their papers.
            children
	   Sara married Paul Gapker and has one known son in Brooklyn.
            boy
	   Tzivya may have perished in the Holocaust.
        
   Szyja  (1885 - 1885) died in Dubiecko, Poland.
   Moshe (1888/90 - 1957) was born in Hucisko, Poland. He married Perel Kutcher and had four children. He moved to Israel.
	   Leah married a Reif.
	   Bronya married a Rottenstreich and lives in Israel.
	   Pesel married a Damchenko.
	   Chaim of Brooklyn, NY.
	   
   Harry  (May 15, 1896 - ?) was married to Sarah and they had two children. Listed as Hersch Meilech, he came to the USA on Sept 26, 1913 aboard the Pretoria out of Hamburg, Germany. His brother Moshe was still in Hucisko when Harry left.His Brooklyn naturalization papers list his occupation as furrier. In 1923 he was married with one child and living at 339 Bedford Avenue in Brooklyn NY.
	   Norman married and now lives in Florida. He has two known daughters.
            Sharon Kuebbing & Rosalee
	   Rhoda
	   
  





I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.
Moishe Millermoishe@langsam.com

My home address is
           1374 East 28th Street
           Brooklyn NY 11210-5311
           USA

  
Last updated 11/14/01

http://www.ics.uci.edu/~dan/genealogy/Miller/langsam/abrm-h19.htm
##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Abraham Abba Langsam Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Abraham Abba Langsam Family





Abraham Abba Langsam had one known son. This information comes from public records, as researched by Ms. Estelle Guzik and Ms. Suzan Wynne. 

Leon (Yom Tov) (1864 - December 29, 1960)  married Bertha/Beila (1872? - Oct 19, 1939) and had five known children. Leon and Bertha came to the USA in 1888 and were naturalized. They are both buried at Mount Hebron Cemetery in Flushing NY (Ohave Shalom - Block 2). In 1900 they lived at 131 Pitt Street. Leon was not a doctor but a cabinet maker. He lived at 848 Gates Avenue, Brooklyn NY in 1902, as his nephew Abramah (Adolf) Langsam described him in his 1904 arrival. That means that Leon had a brother Selig Langsam and the families are connected. Adolf (Selig's son) Langsam's ship manifest seems to imply there is a connection from the H59 section to the H19 section of the tree. 
        Abraham (April 28, 1892 - ?) was born in New York. He shows on the 1900 census but is not listed on any subsequent census records, including 1905. No death record is found in ItalianGen.
        Augusta/Gussie (1894 - ?) was born in NY. No proof of her future life is available. However, marriage records in NYC list an Augusta marrying Nathan H Eglowstein on August 23, 1914 in Manhattan (cert #22186). There are census records for an Augusta and Harry N Eglowstein for 1920, 1930 and 1940. It shows a family living in Paterson, NJ with children Madelin (1915), Audrey (1917) and Edith (1928). City directory records show them there still in 1960. SSDI has an entry for an Augusta passing away in November 1984. Records from Congregation Shevet Achim (of Mercer Island, WA) Yizkor Book 5774 show a memorial entry that would further imply that Audrey Eglowstein married Paul Meyers and that they had a daughter Bev married to Eddie Horwitz (son of Anna F. & Harold J. Horwitz). 
        Helen/Annie (1896 - ?) was born in NY. In the 1930 census she still shows as single, living with her parents.
        Joseph (1899 - ? ) was born in NY. In the 1930 census he still shows as single, living with his parents.
        Sadie/Sonia (1904 - ?) was born in NY. There is an October 14, 1926
marraige record of a Sonia Langsam to William Fischberg in Manhattan. They also show up together on the same in-bound passenger manifest for the RMS Mauretania on March 12, 1953 (a cruise from NY via the West Indies). Augusta is from Paterson, NJ and Sonia is at 38 East 85th Street, NY. There is an SSDI record for a Sonia with a date of passing of 22 Dec 1999.
        






I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.
Moishe Millermoishe@langsam.com

My home address is
           1374 East 28th Street
           Brooklyn NY 11210-5311
           USA

  
Last updated 11/4/2014

http://www.ics.uci.edu/~dan/genealogy/Miller/langsam/hrsh-h36.htm
##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Hersch Langsam Family of Blazowa, Poland
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Hersch Langsam Family of Blazowa, Poland




Some background email from the family can be found here.



Hersch Langsam (1870 - c.1942) was married to Rochel and had seven known children. On Aug 29, 1910 he traveled to the USA aboard the Prinz Friedrich Wilhelm out of Bremen, Germany. He was going to his brother-in-law, Jacob Weber. His wife did not travel with him. He later returned to Europe (before 1920). He perished in the Holocaust. 

Jacob (Nov 15, 1891 - Sep 1969) was born in Blazowa, Poland. He married to Fannie and they had two known children. Later in life he married Rose (1908 - 1974). His profession was a shoemaker. He came to the USA on Jul 13, 1910 aboard the Bremen, sailing out of Bremen, Germany. He was going to his uncle, Jacob Weber, in NYC. 
        Max (Apr 10, 1915 - July 1987) married twice. With his first wife, Sylvia, he had two children. He subsequently married Celia and had two more children. 
            Stanley, Andrew, Suzan & Penny
        Jennie  married Jack Bush and had two children.
            Robert & Fay
        
   Ksil was married.
   Yosef Yitzchok (1896 - 1967) was married to Rose and had three children.
        Clara 
		Nathan married Celia Silverstein	and has five children.
            Andrea, Rose, Harvey, Jeffrey & Alan
		Max has one known son.
            Marc
        
   Clara (1898 - ?) was born in Blazowa as Chaya. She came to the USA as a single girl on Dec 13, 1920 aboard the Canada, sailing out of Marseilles, Bouches-du-Rhone, France. She was going to her uncle Weber on Madison Avenue in NYC. Clara married Morris Seckler and had two children.
        Shirley married Alex Wasserman and had two children. 
            child & child
		Ruth married Sidney Schwartz and had two children. 
            child & child
        
   Aharon (1902 - 1939) came to Danzig (today, Gdansk) in the year 1929 from his  hometown in Poland - Blazowa. He married Esther Leinhardt in December of 1929. Life was good in those years, but became unbearable in 1934 when the Nazi Party in Danzig gained strength and Jews were being persecuted. They had two sons, their second one being born in 1937. In September 1939 the Wehrmacht (German army) attacked the Polish garrison on Westerplatte which controlled the entrance to the Danzig harbour. Jews were being send to concentrations camps. Aharon and other heads of household escaped on a illegal ship bound for Palestine. The boat was detained in Yugoslavia and all 1300 men and woman were shot dead by the Nazis and buried in a mass grave in Sabac, Yugoslavia. Esther and her two sons stayed on in Danzig waiting for another opportunity to flee. Finally, in August 1940, they left by train and then boat. It was intercepted by a British warship while trying to bring Jewish refugees to the shores of Palestine. They were detained in Atlith, Palestine, where Herman, then only three years old, died of typhoid. Esther and Oscar were exiled to Mauritius. 
        Oscar Jehoshua married Hadassa Goldrosen and has two children. They live in Israel. 
            Nachum & Racheli Iluz
		Herman (1937 - 1940)
        
   Sura Gitel
   Yente
   

Some background email from the family can be found here.





I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.
Moishe Millermoishe@langsam.com

           1374 East 28th Street

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Reisel Adler nee Langsam Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Reisel Adler nee Langsam Family





Reisel Langsam (Feb 20, 1864 - ?), daughter of Meilach and Golda Langsam of Kanczuga, Poland, was married to Isaac Adler, son of Eisig and Mindel of Panavolice. Meliach Langsam passed away before his daughter was actually born. This information comes from Polish records, as researched by Mr. Arye Barkai and Ms. Suzan Wynne. Reisel and Isaac had five known children.

Itta (Mar 25, 1886 - ?)    
Hersh Meilech (Jul 19, 1887 - ?)
Leib (Jan 17, 1890 - ?)
Moses (Nov 22, 1895 - ?)
Sarah (Jan 19, 1901 - ?)

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Selig Langsam Family of Krakow, Poland
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Selig Langsam Family of Krakow, Poland




Some background email from the family can be found here.



Selig Langsam was married to Ruje and had six known children. Selig's brother was Leon Langsam, as Adolf's ship manifest states, so there is a connection from this H59 section to the H19 section of the tree. That makes Selig's father Abraham Abba Langsam. 

Adolf (1885 - ?) was married to Gussie and they had three known children. He came to the USA on May 5, 1904 aboard the Pennsylvania, sailing out of Hamburg, Germany. Adolf, listed as Abraham, was still single upon his arrival. He was going to his uncle, Dr. Leon Langsam; 848 Galber (?) Ave, Brooklyn NY. His occupation was listed as saddler
        Leo was married to Rose. They had no children.
        David Shmuel married Hattie Smith and had two children.
            Howard Earl & Louis (1940-2000)
        Rosalind married Louis Quaytman and had one son.
            Miles
        
   Anna (1887 - ?) came to the USA on Feb 2, 1906 aboard the Pretoria sailing out of Hamburg, Germany. She was single and traveling to her brother, Adolf Langsam. Her profession was dressmaker.
   Isak (July 8, 1888 - Jul 1979) was born in Krakow, Poland. He married Jenny, of Tarnow, Poland, born about 1888. They had three children. His wife predeceased him and he married a woman named Golda. Isak came to the USA on Oct 19, 1906 aboard the Pretoria sailing out of Hamburg, Germany. He went to his brother, Adolf Langsam, then living at 127 Forsyth St, NYC. In 1916 they were living in Brooklyn at 162 Harrison Avenue with their two oldest children. The FHC's Krakow birth index lists an Izak Langsam, born in 1888, Akt 401, film 1895667. An Abraham Aba is listed next, born 1889, Akt 260, film 1895667. The father of the H19 Leon Langsam is known to have been Avrohm Aba. This seems to be another indication that H59 and H19 are connected. Isak, later known as Isidore, was a hatter
        Ralph (Feb 19, 1911 - Mar 1973) was born in Newark, NJ. He married Bernice and had two children.
            Lawrence & Diane
		Abraham (1914 - 1958) married Sylvia and had two children.
            Richard & Bette Lynn Pricer
		Solomon married Marsha and has one son.
            Joel
        
   Ida (1892 - ?) was born in Dumbrouki, Poland. She came to the USA on Jul 5, 1920  aboard the Philadelphia sailing out of Southampton, Southamptonshire, England, UK. Ida went to her brother, Isaac Langsam, then living at 606 138th St, Bronx NY. Her father was still living in Krakow at the time. Ida was a widow and it would appear her late husband's surname was Nachemie.
   Golde (1893 - ?) was born in Krakow, Poland. She came to the USA on May 16, 1908  aboard the Kaiserin Auguste Victoria sailing out of Hamburg, Germany. Golda lists her brother as her destination; Adolf Langsam, 1424 2nd Ave NYC. Her mother is listed as Ruje Langsam, residing at 12 Czemmuszika (?) Str, Krakow.
   girl was married to Jacob Schultz of NY.
   

Some background email from the family can be found here.

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Mordechai Langsam Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Mordechai Langsam Family





Mordechai Langsam was known to have been a descendent of the Bnei Yissoschur, R' Hersh Mylech Spira. This most likely places this branch in the L5 section of the "Langsam-Spira Family Tree" book, as many of those Langsams claim descent via both Chaim Leib Langsam and his brother, the Bnei Yissoschur. Mordechai had one known son. According to Mordechay (Moti) Pollack, Mordechai Langsam (1878 - 1953) was from Lesko, a son of Joseph, son of Yona Langsam. See his email describing this.

Yitzchok of Linsk had one known daughter.
        girl married to Nocum Meir Heller. 
            Chana Sarah Weinreb
        
  





I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.
Moishe Millermoishe@langsam.com

           1374 East 28th Street
           Brooklyn NY 11210-5311

##------------------URL-------------------------##
http://www.ics.uci.edu/~dan/genealogy/Miller/langsam/saml-h15.htm
##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Shmuel Langsam Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Shmuel Langsam Family




Some background email from the family can be found here.



Itzhak David (Isaac or David) Langsam (c.1857 - 1948), son of Shmuel Langsam, was married to Malka Shnell (1859 - 1943) from Bircza, Poland. They had seven known children. On Sep 22, 1922 he arrived in NY aboard the Lafayette, sailing from Le Havre, Seine-Inferior, France. At the time he had a son living in Dobromil-Bircza, Poland. He was going to another son in the Bronx, probably Aaron. His wife and two of their grandchildren accompanied him on the voyage. On the ship manifest it lists his naturalization as occurring on 12/18/36, #2-497737. David and Malka lived in the Bronx (NY) and were storekeepers until he was 90 years old. He had about five more brothers, one of whom was named Moshe.

Mordechai/Marcus (1880 - 1943) was married twice. He had one known daughter from his first marriage. After his wife passed away he married her sister. He perished in the Holocaust.
        Esther married a Stavitsky.
            Robert (previously in MD, the only one listed now resides in Westbury, NY)
        
	Aaron (c.1884 - 1959) was married to Sarah (Sadie) Rabi (1887 - 1959) in 1906. She was a first cousin to Prof. I. I. Rabi, awarded the Nobel Prize for Physics in 1944. Aaron and Sadie had five children. 
        Alexander (Oct 22, 1907 - Jan 31, 2000) married Florence and they had two children. Florence died in a car accident and Alexander remarried to Gerry. They lived in Connecricut and later Maryland. 
            Mark & Marsha Beth
		Esther married Kurt Marcus but had no children.
        Genevive/Jennie married Leo Freiser. They had three children. 
            Joel, Barbara Levy & Michael
        Helen married Max Glicksman and had two daughters. 
            Ruth Kasloff & Marion Closter
		Tillie/Toba married George Lieberman. They had three children. 
            Evelyn Rosenthal, David & Arnold
        
	Nathan (18? - 1929) married Raylia (Rose) Aram and had six known children. She first came to the USA in 1903, but went back to Europe right before WW I. She returned to the USA on Oct 30, 1920, with all her children. Nathan was living at 505 E 166th Stret, Bronx, NY, at the time. This family probably originated in Przemysl, Poland, and not Bircza. Nathan was a storekeeper and was shot in the back during a hold-up while protecting his daughter, Gertrude. He died of his injuries a year later.
        George/Gedalia (1909 - 1969) was not married. He lived with his mother Rose all his life.
		Clara/Sara (1911-2002) married Hyman Minkin and had two children.
            Elaine Schwartz & Norma Miller
		Gertrude/Nantze (1913 -1996) married Jacob Schatz (1910 - 1979). They had two daughters.
            Natalie Schechter & Barbara Kremer
		Solomon (1915 - 1945) was born in Bircza, Poland. Rosie decided to visit her family in Poland in the year 1914. She went with her three young children while pregnant with her fourth (Solomon). They were trapped in Poland for all of WW I. Nathan, still in the USA, had the Red Cross searching for them, as he did not know if the family had survived. The family returned after the end of the war. Sol married Bella. They divorced after one year of marriage and had no known children. He died in an accident after WW II. He went through battles on Afirca, Italy, Sicily, France, Belgium, Germany without a scratch. He came home and went into a roofing business. Climbing down a ladder from a roofing job he sliped; his nose broke and punctured his brain. He was only 29 years old.
		Blanche married Milton Fishman and had two children.
            Linda & Neil
		Pearl married Nathan Bassuk and lived in Long Beach, NY. They had one daughter.
            Bonnie
        
	Annie married Max Lishner and had five known children.
        Saul
		Leo
		Sidney
		Helen
		Esther
        
	Rosie married Sam Mark (previously Jarmark). They had two daughters.
        Tillie
		Estelle
        
	Pauline married Sam Tuchman and had two known children.
        Murray
		girl died at age 10.
        
	Moishe (1902 - ) had no known children.
        

Some background email from the family can be found here.

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Yissochor Dov (Beirish) Langsam Family of Bircza & Sanok
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Yissochor Dov (Beirish) Langsam Family of Bircza & Sanok




Some background email from the family can be found here.



Yissochor Dov (Beirish) Langsam (June 6, 1849 - ?) was born in Bircza, Poland. He married Esther Moritz (born September 9, 1846) of Sanok and had two known children born in Sanok. The four of them show up together on the 1900 census. 

Efraim  (October 11, 1880 - abt 1941) was born in Sanok, Poland. He married Rachel and lived in Koln, Germany where they had three known children. Based on Pages of Testimony at Yad Vashem, he was deported to Poland in 1938 and perished in Siberia in 1941. 
        Ahuva  lived in Tel-Aviv, Israel and was married to a Rosenfeld.
        Chava  lived in Holon, Israel and was married to a Tzuriel.
        child  with no other detail known.
        
   Moshe Shlomo  (March 15, 1882 - August 1942) was married to Ides Treff of During the Holocaust they were in Dukla and they both perished in August of 1942.
        Regina (1906 - 1999) married Chaskel Shraga Goldberg and they had one known daughter. 
            Malka Finkel
		Goldie married Hyman Hollander and had two known children.
            Steven & Marian Lorraine Wezenter
		Benny was married and had two known children.
            child & Marilyn
		Esther married a Blaut and they had one known son. 
            Milton
		Sydney Arnold (1909 - 1990) married Mary Mariyum Goldberg and they had one known daughter. 
            Ida S.

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Leibush Langsam Family of Tyrawa Woloska
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Leibush Langsam Family of Tyrawa Woloska





Subject:  Re: The JewishGen Family Finder: LANGSAM 
From:  Ira Teich  
Date:  Sun, Nov 23, 2014 2:12 am 
To:  "moishe.miller@totalben.com"  
   
Hello Moshe 
I believe we have exchanged emails some years ago. I have not posted info in many years. 
My aunt, Leah Teich, married  Leibush Langsam, in Brzozow, a few years before ww2.
She and their 3 small children were murdered in 1941. Leibush tried to cross the Sanok 
river into Russia and I believe was killed in that attempt. 

I also have a great great great grandfather named avram aba (teich). Other family names 
in my tree include gottleib/gotfried, Shulman, fink, esterles, frum. 

My family was known (internally) by a mysterious name: family of the golden flag. But I have 
never been able to find a reference to that anywhere, and it remains a mystery. 

Best regards,

Ira
Ira (Israel-Dov) Teich

Sent from my iPhone - so please excuse the inevitable typos.

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Hersh Mylech Langsam Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
Hersh Mylech Langsam Family





From: "Carolyn"

Date: Tue, 1 Oct 2002 02:11:40 -0400 


Hi Moishe,
I am working on a tree for a fellow here on Long Island.(He has the tree, I
have the computer) He has a Langsam family in the Bronx, and I couldn't find
any information on your web page...So I'm hoping you have something in your
database that will help tell me more about the family.


I contacted Susan Wynne two years ago, and she wouldn't give me the time of
day...forget any help or information.


The attachment has all the basic info on it.


I will be sending photo's of headstones to you hoping you can tell me more
about the people.  The photo's are marked.


Thanks,


Carolyn Putterman
St. James, NY

Cousins Rose & Anna.jpg

Subject: Re: Have A Langsam Inquiry

Dear Carol,

I am fascinated by what you sent. I do not have a clear connection yet, but 
everything fits in with the family. We had MANY Hersh Mylech (Tzvi Elimelech) 
Langsam's in the family. Chunks of the tree came from both Kanczuga and 
Prezworsk.Can you provide siblings names or when these people came to the 
USA?

Please stay in touch. I would be interested to see any other scans you might 
have.

From: "Carolyn"  
To:  
Subject: RE: Have A Langsam Inquiry 
Date: Wed, 2 Oct 2002 02:02:39 -0400 


Well Moishe, here it is......


Louis & Anna (Langsam) Katz both immigrated between 1888-1891.


I haven't determined if they were married in Poland or here in NY. I found
three Langsam ladies on the NYC marriage index, but none were Anna. (I do
have copies of those marriage records)


Their Children all born in NY
Harry - 1894 - 1961
Irving - 1896-1962
Agusta (Gussie) 1898-1988
Charles - 1901-1979
Molly Esther - 1903-1996
Morris - 1911-living
=========================================
Morris Waldman (his parents Joseph Waldman & Eva Berger)
He immigrated in 1888. Some of his children came in with him, and others
came in before 1891. From what I can determine, Rose Waldman and Anna
(Langsam) Katz may have come in together. Further work to be done at NARA.
The last one to arrive was Nathan in 1900 with a daughter Pauline. (Who does
not show up on the Ellis Island DataBase, but I did find him on the Holland
American Database at the NYCPL on microfiche).


My main question about Nathan is, who was he living with in Poland if the
rest of his family was here?   Morris Waldman's headstone alludes to him
being a Rabbi. He was not a Rabbi here, but a Kosher wine merchant on
Attorney Street.  Nathan born in Prezworsk, married a women from Krakow, a
Reisner, who could also be a Rabbinical Family.  I have always wondered if
Nathan was in studies for Rabbinical work, and wasn't very good at it, and
they threw him out….if that is possible.


His Children that we know of….could have had more in Poland
The range in DOB's kinda tells me he did have 2 wives and more kids.
Louis - 1862-1910
Fanny - 1866-1950
Jenny - 1875-1938
Nathan - 1876-1944
Rose - 1880-1940
Molly - 1885-1944


Rose Waldman and Anna Langsam were VERY close. From family members who knew
the ladies, "these two women were almost inseparable".  They lived within 2
blocks of each other in the Bronx.


Both families lived on the Lower East Side until the mid twenty's and moved
"en mass" to the Bronx.


I have six photos' I'll be sending to you.  I don't read Hebrew hopefully
you do. Maybe you can gleen some information from the stones.  Morris
Waldman's stone is hard to read in the photo's.  The fellow who translated
the stone was not good at it either. I sure would like a good translation
some day. He is buried at Union Fields Cemetery, Sinavar Cong. Anche
Sfaard - Section 54 - Row 1 Plot 5


I do thank you very much for getting back to me.


Carolyn

From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: Re: Louis Katz

At 01:58 AM 10/2/02 -0400, you wrote:
Look at the top of the headstone carefully.....

That is the symbol of the Kohain blessing the people. Katz is an 
abbreviation for "Kohain Tzedek" - righteous Kohain.

Hebrew:
Here lies
Aryeh son of R' Yehuda the Kohain
passed away 5 Teves 5704

Date: Thu, 03 Oct 2002 20:50:28 -0400
To: "Carolyn" 
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: RE: Kanczuga and Katz

Hi,
I think I may have a match. I found a Hersh Mylech, which is a nickname for Tzvi 
Elimelech. Tzvi in Hebrew means a deer. Hersh is the Yiddish word for deer. He 
was Kanczuga and was known by his middle name, Mylech. He was married to a Goldy, 
surname unknown. For some details, see H2 at
http://www.ics.uci.edu/~dan/genealogy/Miller/langsam/reisl-h2.htm
If they are the same people, then Reisel is the sister of Anna.

Also, for the people living next door to the Rich's, please see H13 at
http://www.ics.uci.edu/~dan/genealogy/Miller/langsam/efrm-h13.htm

Furthermore, is your Schoenfeld connected to my tree through his paternal line? 
I have MANY Schoenfeld's. Please see:
http://www.ics.uci.edu/~dan/genealogy/Miller/spira/bny-yscr.htm

For another Nantze, please see
http://www.ics.uci.edu/~dan/genealogy/Miller/langsam/saml-h15.htm

Another startling concept, there are Reich's in the tree from Kanczuga as well. 
Again on page
http://www.ics.uci.edu/~dan/genealogy/Miller/spira/bny-yscr.htm
there is a daughter Baila, who had married R' Shimon Yeshaya Reich, had an 
unnamed daughter. This daughter had a son, R' Shimon Yeshaya Reich, who was 
judge (in Jewish court) in Kanczuga.

You can view
http://www.ics.uci.edu/~dan/genealogy/Miller/langsam/eidb.htm
and do a find on "Kan" to see Langsam's that came from Kanczuga.

I think this Morris is VERY important to us. Please try to find out more about 
his aunts or uncles. Who were his maternal grandfather's siblings? Does he know 
of any Langsam cousins?

Lastly (for now), do you have any of the death records for the Langsam's you 
found in the cemetery? 

Hope I have not overwhelmed you,
Moishe

I live very close to SUNY at Stony Brook. I found up there on microfiche the
following map:


Austro-Hungarian Monarchy  1875
by the Militargeographisches Institut.
Call No: G6480 s75.A84
Microfiche #A937.


I copied it while in Wash DC last month, but it is nice to know it is in my
back yard if I need it.  I'm in the process of scotch taping the sections
together to find the town the Waldman's came from.  Phonetically, it is
spelled Yel-schild. Got that pronunciation straight from a lady who's mother
was one of the Waldman's that immigrated in to the US. She just died about 9
months ago at the age of 98. Boy was she sharp of mind.

figure it out.

Thank you
Carolyn
______________________________________________________
Date: Sun, 06 Oct 2002 02:35:09 -0400
To: "Carolyn" 
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: RE: Kanczuga and Katz

Hersh Mylech is a nickname for Tzvi Elimelech. These are both used as given 
names, not surnames. Langsam, a surname, translates from Yiddish or German 
to mean "slowly".

Moritz, a given name, can be any one of several Hebrew names, including Moshe 
or Menachem (Mendel).

______________________________________________________
From: "Carolyn"  
To:  
Subject: RE: Kanczuga and Katz 
Date: Mon, 7 Oct 2002 01:03:39 -0400 


Thanks Moishe, so I'm still looking for the same last name, but the first
two names will read different...got it.
Carolyn

Read this....
*Anna (Nentshya) Langsam was with Louis Katz in Przemysl - They probably 
 were married there
*She was born September 15, 1873...fast math tells me that she 17 and 
 was married shortly before they sailed.
*The "Werkdendam" arrived in NYC on Sept 18th, 1891
That is if this whole thing is true....
====================================================
Declaration of Intention: Date - Dec 2, 1918 - Bronx County
In the Supreme Court of Bronx County
      I Louis Katz, aged 55 years, occupation Peddeler, do declare on oath 
	  that my personal description is:  Color white, complexion fair, height 
	  4 feet 10 inches, weight 110 pounds, color of hair Brown, color of eyes 
	  Brown other visible distinctive marks, none.
      I was born in Premizie Austria on the 15th day of Jan, anno Domini 1863;  
	  I now reside at 1443 Washington Ave, New York City, NY.
      I emigrated to the United States of America from Rotterdam, Holland on 
	  the vessel "unknown"; my last foreign residence was Premzil, Romania, 
	  wife Anna same address.
      It is my bona fide intention to renounce forever all allegiance and 
	  fidelity to any foreign prince, potentate, state, or sovereignty, and 
	  particularly to Charles, Emperor of Austria and Apostolig King of 
	  Hungary, of whom I am now a subject;
      I arrived at the port of New York in the state of New York, on or about 
	  the 19th day of Sept, anno Domini 1891;  I am not an anarchist;  I am not 
	  a polygamist nor a believer in the practice of polygamy; and it is my 
	  intention if good faith to become a citizen of the United States of America 
	  and to permanently reside therein; So Help Me G-d.           
	  (Signature affixed)
      Subscribed and sworn to before me in the office of the Clerk of Court at 
	  New York City, NY this 2nd day of Dec, anno Domini 1918.
      Joseph M. Callahan Clerk of the Supreme Court

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Yosef Menachem Mendel Langsam Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Yosef Menachem Mendel Langsam Family





Yosef Menachem Mendel Langsam (1840 - ?) was born in Rakowa, Poland. He married Chaya Doples and they had five known children. They lived in Tyrawa Woloska, Poland.
Beila married Abraham Moshe Ber and had six known children. 
        Uscher
        Aizig
        Hersch
        Iosl married Laura Wilk and had one known son.
		    Iosel(?)
        Nujem (c.1904 - ) married Dora Mandel and had three known children. He went to Argentina in 1930. His wife and three year old daughter joined him in 1933.
		    Juana, Manuel & Isaac
        
	Reisel married David Zweig and had eight known children. They lived in Sanok, Poland after they married, but later moved to Essen, Germany.
        Pinchas (1898 - 1968)
        Gittel (c.1900 - ?) married a Hofferman and lived in Los Angeles, CA.
        Frieda married a Shrager.
        Max
        Sylvia
        Rachel married Abraham Goldblatt and lived in Israel.
        Chaim married a Katz and lived in Mexico.
        Ryvka was married twice, the second husband was a Seidman. She lived in Los Angeles, CA and had three children.
		    David, Rose & Sophia
        
	Frimet of Rakowa, Poland married Leiser Langsam and had one known daughter born in Tyrawa Woloska, Poland. 
        Reisli married Markus Moretz and had one known daughter.
		    Zirel Moritz-Fischerman
        
	girl no other detail is known. 
	Shraga Feivel (c.1867 - 1952) married Tziril Hornik and had fourteen children. Not all of their children survived to adulthood; seven are known.
        Eliasz (1899 - ) was born in Zagorz, Poland.  He married Breindel and had four children. Some resided in Israel and at least one in Argentina.
		    Fischel, Rachel, Celia Schulman, & Hentshe Pauker
        Eliyahu (1901 - 1944) perished in the Holocaust, near the war's end. He married He married Pearl Feld and had three sons born to him in Zagorz, Poland. The family went to Russia at the start of the war. Due to illness, Eliyahu was unable to join them.
		    Harry, Sol, & Isaac
        Jacob (1905 - 1927)
        Aron lives in Los Angeles, CA. He married Chava and has one son, who lives nearby to him.
		    Melvin
		Freida (? - 1965) died in NY.  She married Leibush Krappel-Strenger in 1922 in Poland. They had three children.
		    Ceila Bell, Sam & Chaya Neiger
        Shabsi (? - c.1914) was recruited into military service in 1914 and was taken prisoner by the Russians and never returned.
        Yente  never married and lived in a nursing home in Israel.
        






I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.
Moishe Millermoishe@langsam.com

           1374 East 28th Street

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Efraim Langsam Family of Lutowska, Poland
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Efraim Langsam Family of Lutowska, Poland




Efraim Langsam (1854 - 1929), son of Pesach, was married twice. His second wife was Chaya Sprecher of Lemberg and they had two known children. At first they lived in Lutowska but then moved to a farm. His wife perished in the Holocaust. He had sons, possibly from his first marriage, that settled in the USA before the Holocaust.

Sarah was married to a Steckel and had one known son.
        Jack lives in Canada.
        
   girl lived in Canada and did not marry.
   Pesach (April 05, 1916 - September 28, 1995 [Tishrei 4]) was married to Regina/Rivka Chwerd and had four children. He changed his surname to Sprecher at the conclusion of World War II. Pesach had studied in the Bobowa yeshiva in Myslenice, Poland for a time and also lived in Tyrawa Woloska, Poland. He settled in the United States after the war.
        Efraim married Shirley Mermelstein and has two known children.They live in Israel.
            Yonah & Toba
                Shlomo married Mati Goldwirth and has four known children.
            Chumie, Eli, Uri & girl
                Mendel married Feigie Lederfine and has two known children.
            Meir & Esther
                Chaya married Eli Brociner and has two known children.
            Shlomo & Sarah
        




I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.

           1374 East 28th Street
           Brooklyn NY 11210-5311

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Eugene Langsam Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Eugene Langsam Family





From: "Ilse Zilversmit" <izilver@attcanada.ca> 
To: <moishe@langsam.com> 
Subject: Re: Family Tree of the Jewish People: Eugen LANGSAM 
Date: Thu, 22 Jun 2000 14:04:21 -0400 
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 5.00.2615.200 


Dear Moishe,
I looked through your website. A ganze Megilla. Too much to read. I srolled
through it
and couldn't find Langsam. Maybe I went too fast.
(This is the second letter, the first one disappeared all of a sudden while
writing)
Anyway I'll give you what I have. Do you have anything with the familyname
Bier?
I think most of it is from Germany and it starts this way:


Jitschok Bier, about 1685
One of his children Shimshon Jitschok Bier
One of his children David Simon Bier 1747-1823
One of his children  Jacob David Bier
One of his childdren Jacob Cossman Bier. Married Susanna Isac.
Some of their children 1 David
                                  2 Isaak
                                  3 Rebecca bier married August Warendorf;
                                    They had a daughter Sophie Warendorf who
married a ? Langsam'
They had a son Eugene (or a daughter Eugenie?) because it is not clear if he
married a Carla
Heimann (or she married a Carl Heiman. The trail is dead.


I am a descendant of  Jacob David Bier.
One of his children was  Sophie Bier who married Jonas Fassbender.
One of their children was Eva Fassbender who married Abraham Meyerhof, my
grandmother
Rosalie's parents.
Rosalie married Hermann Randerath. They had 4 children. One of them was
Lotte.
She married my father Henri van Collem from Holland. (Sounds goyish but a
very good
Dutch Jewish name.
I am one of Henri and Lotte's children. My dad was murdered in Bergen
Belsen. My mom died
7 years ago at the age of 93. She my sister (in Israel) and I made it alive
out of Bergen Belsen.
Sorry not to be able to give you anything more.
I got some of my information from James Steckerl, the son of a cousin of my
mother who lives in England.
If you are at all interested, let me know and I give you his e-mail.


All the best, Ilse Zilversmit-nee van Collem.

http://www.ics.uci.edu/~dan/genealogy/Miller/langsam/pesac-h1.htm
##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Pesach Langsam Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Pesach Langsam Family





Mendel Langsam (1854 - Dec 24, 1932), son of Pesach Langsam, was married to Chaya/Sarah/Jennie. Mrs. Barbara Blosveren related that her father told her Mendel shot a man and had to escape, fleeing Jaroslaw, Poland. Mendel had five known children. The 1900 census for Emann Langsam shows him marrying in 1873. His NYC death record lists him as living in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn, NY as a retired tailor. He was in the USA since 1886 and is buried at Mt. Zion Cemetery (with a synagogue society - Independent Congregation Ohel Itzchok Anshe Zurawner, associated with Zhuravno, in Ukraine, formerly Galicia, Path 10 Left, Gate Road) in Flushing, NY.Imigration records show him leaving thru Hamburg on his way to New York via Liverpool. He arrived in New York with 3 other Langsam family members (Sarah age 21, Rosa -age 3 months and Marcus, age 19) on 27 May 1885. They must have gone back, becuase Mendel and Sure (Sarah) show up again leaving Hamburg on 10 Sep 1886. 

David (March 1877 - 1950) arrived in 1889 according to the 1900 census. He married Rose Landesman in Manhattan NY on April 1, 1900. They lived in Brooklyn, NY and had three children. 
        Nathan/Nathaniel (March 3, 1901 - November 1985) married Sarah Seligman. They had two children. 
            Marjorie Feldheim & Judy Merl
        Edward (November 6, 1906 - July 1986) was a doctor. He married Dianne and worked for Neptune Moving. They had no children.
		Henry (July 23, 1909 - May 2001) married Gertrude Feinstein. They had one daughter. 
            Barbara Amy Blosveren
        
   Betsy/Bessie (May 1877 - ? Apr 26, 1918 ?) was born in Poland. She married Maykil Finger on March 8, 1896 in Manhattan. They had three known children. In 1918, as per his WW I draft record, they were living at 69 Central Avenue in Brooklyn and ownned a grocery at 65 Central Avenue. Micheal lists Esther as his next of kin.
   					There is a Bessie that is recorded in the NYC Vital Records as having passed away at the age of 40 on Apr 26, 1918 (Cert #10285 in Brooklyn). 
					There is also a record of a marriage for a Michael Finger to a Bella Spiegel on Jan 8, 1920 in Brooklyn (cert #1475).
					The 1920 census lists Michael and Esther and records Michael as widowed.
        Izzy married Estelle and has one known child. They were known to be living in New York. 
            boy
		Samuel (Nov 12, 1898 - ?) was born in Manhattan. He was drafted for WW I and he is not listed on his parent's 1920 census records. 
		Ethel/Esther (Aug 2, 1903 - Nov 9, 2000) married Izzy Rand and had one child. They were known to be living in New York. 
            Barbara Stillman
        
   Louie (Sep 12, 1879 - May 15, 1962) was a plumber and married Bessie Mantch in Manhattan, NY on Mar 6, 1904. Sometime between 1910 and the WW I draft he relocated to Detroit with his family. They had two known children.
        Mildred was born about 1907. She may be the Miriam Langsam listed in the NYC vital records as being born on Oct 2, 1907 in Manhattan (cert #51632).

		Gertrude was born about 1913. 
        
   Hymie  (1882 - ?) was married to Minnie Fuchs in Manhattan on Aug 26, 1906. They had three children.
        Arthur (1908 - ?) married Adele Bradwell and had two children. 
            Lilly Kaplan & Mary Quartin
		Paul passed away as an infant.
		Marvin (1912 -  1961) married Charlotte Levy and had one child. 
            Marvin
        
   Isidore (1884 - ?) married Kate Newman and had two children. They moved to Far Rockaway in 1923.
        Herbert married Roslyn (Roddy) Seevak. They have four children and live in San Francisco, CA.
            Robin Blum, Jon Dexter, Heidi Baldauf, & Pamela 
		Sanford (Mar 5, 1914 - Jan 6, 1995) married Jere Victor and had two children.
            Bonnie Gartner & Nancy 
        
   





I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.
Moishe Millermoishe@langsam.com

My home address is
           1374 East 28th Street
           Brooklyn NY 11210-5311
           USA

  
Last updated 10/11/14

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
David & Martin Langsam
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
David & Martin Langsam






From: JoFlBr@aol.com 
Date: Mon, 14 Feb 2000 12:17:39 EST 
Subject: re: David Langsam 
To: moishe@langsam.com 
X-Mailer: AOL 5.0 for Windows sub 44 


My son-in-law forwarded me your e-mail with regard to the above David Langsam.
The only information I have about that name is the following:
My husband's father had a brother by the name of Mendel Benjamin Brashem who 
was married to Sarah Rosumny.  They had three daughters, the eldest Ruth 
married a Dave Langsam in 1939.  They had one son Martin born in 1945.  Ruth 
was blind and the family did not feel that she could take care of Martin and 
he was adopted by another sister by the name of Myrtle who was married to 
Lester Kirklin and they raised him.  I do not know if this is any relation to 
your David Langsam.

Joan Brashem  
_______________________________________________________

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Shmiel Langsam Family of Drobitzka (Debica?)
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Shmiel Langsam Family of Drobitzka (Debica?)





From: "Howard Nightingale" <baker1@yesic.com> 
To:  
Subject: Langsam family tree. 
Date: Sun, 4 Feb 2001 10:55:55 -0500 
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 5.00.2314.1300 


  
I am new to researching my family, and by accident I came across your family tree.  I have a 
Pesel Sauerhaft who married a David (?).  They had several children, one of whom Rachel (?) 
married a Shmiel Langsam during the war.  They both died in 1942.
 
Do I have the right family tree.  If not, please point me in the direction where I may continue 
my search.
 
Thanking you in advance.
 
Howard Nightingale
_________________________________________________________________________
Date: Mon, 05 Feb 2001 15:43:43 -0500
To: "Howard Nightingale" <baker1@yesic.com>
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: Re: Langsam family tree.

Hi,
Thanks for your inquiry. I am researching ALL Langsam's in the belief it is one large family. 
The core seems to be primarily in Galicia and Slovakia. There were many Samuel (anglocized 
version of Shmiel) Langsam's in our family. Can you elaborate at all? Wife's surname (David's)?  
Where they lived? Shmiel's parents? Age? What is your source for Shmiel Langsam? Do you know of 
other Langsam's from his family?

Please stay in touch.

Good Luck!
-Moishe
_________________________________________________________________________
From: "Howard Nightingale" <baker1@yesic.com> 
To:  
Subject: Re: Langsam family tree. 
Date: Tue, 6 Feb 2001 10:01:49 -0500 
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 5.00.2314.1300 


Thank you for your answer.    The information I have on the family is as
follows:


Ephroim and Rifka Sauerhaft had four children:  
Fayge Leah (who married Aaron Adler) 
Pesel who married (David?) 
Golda ( who married Lazar Wiesenfeld) and 
Yaakov Baruch (who married Sheinder Rikel)   

Pesel and David
had  five children: Moishe, Itzik, Rifka, Reisel and Rachel (who married
Shmiel Langsam)  

Ephroim and Rifka lived in Bialoboki, Poland.  Pesel was born in Bialoboki, 
Poland and then married David (?) and moved to Drobitzka (it may be Debica).
David (?) was a farmer.


I hope that this helps.


Looking forward to your reply - maybe we are related.


Howard

Does this ring any bell?

They are now deceased.

The Leo Langsam Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Leo Langsam Family





Leo Langsam was married twice, first to Rose and then to Lillie. He had one known daughter with Rose. This information comes from probate records, as researched by Ms. Suzan Wynne.

Rita (b. 1951)

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Necha Adler nee Langsam Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Necha Adler nee Langsam Family





Necha Langsam daughter of Israel Langsam and Peya Lemmer of Sienawa, Poland, was married to Jacob Adler, son of Aron and Feiga/Fentiny of Manasterez, Poland. This information comes from Polish records, as researched by Mr. Arye Barkai and Ms. Suzan Wynne. Necha and Isaac married in 1926 and had one known son.

Eliezer (1931 - 1933) was only two years old when he died in the town of Manasterez.






I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.
Moishe Millermoishe@langsam.com

My home address is
           1374 East 28th Street
           Brooklyn NY 11210-5311
           USA

  
Last updated 2/14/02

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Ephraim Langsam Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Ephraim Langsam Family





Ephraim Langsam had one known son. This information comes from public records, as researched by Ms. Estelle Guzik and Ms. Suzan Wynne.

Eleazar (Louis) (1875 - 1933) came to the USA in 1888. He was married to Fanny (Feige Devorah), daughter of Lieb and Lena Bair, and they lived in the Bronx. Fanny was about 59 when she passed away on January 13, 1939. She is buried at Mount Hebron cememtery in Flushing, NY (Ohave Sholom - Block 2) with her husband. They had seven known children according to the Langsam-Spira book. Only 3 seem to have survived to adulthood (although a check in the NY death records from 1888 - 1934 did not turn up the other 4 names).
        Edward does not show up on cenuses from 1900, 1910, 1915, 1920, 1925 or 1930
        Joseph	 (1896 - ?) does not show up on cenuses from 1900, 1910, 1915, 1920, 1925 or 1930
        Isidore/Irving (b. 1897) 
        Sadie (b. 1904) married Murray Fox on Jun 24, 1934 in the Bronx, NY. Based soley on the 1940 census, one child is known.
            Lawrence
        Gertrude (b. 1911). There are 2 marriages recorded after the 1930 census in NY for a Gertrude Langsam, but it is not known if either one was her. She was living in the Bronx in 1930 and her brother and sister were there still in 1940:
				Shapiro Morris May 4 1935 Cert 3860 Bronx Soundex S160 ID 2470696Shaw Arthur Nov 7 1936 Cert 19241 Kings Soundex S000 ID 2560340
        Rose does not show up on cenuses from 1900, 1910, 1915, 1920, 1925 or 1930
        Sidney does not show up on cenuses from 1900, 1910, 1915, 1920, 1925 or 1930
        






I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Isaac Langsam Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Isaac Langsam Family




Some background email from the family can be found here.


Isaac Langsam (1873 - Feb 28, 1948), son of Harry and Breindel, married Tillie Guter (c.1872 - 1959) of Hungary. They lived in Philadelphia, PA and had four known children. His death record and cemetery record both give his name as Israel, not Isaac. Isaac/Israel was living at 2215 N. 29th Street when he passed away. He came to the USA in 1890. Their final resting place is at Roosevelt Memorial Park at Feastervl Trvs, PA.

Rosie married Izzy Tomberg, son of Shlomo, and had three children. A tree of this branch (with certain dates that seem to contradict other parts of the larger tree) was found at Jeff Tomberg's website (not related to the Langsam family).
        Saul married Doris Hammel and they had two daughters. He was an attorney.
            Barbara Loss & Debra
        Joseph married Roberta and had two sons. Joe was a judge in Florida.
		    Jeff & Mark
        Sidney Miriam Hershkowitz and had three sons.
		    David, Richard Steven & James
        
   Lillie married Henry Snyder and had three children.
        Sylvia 
        Eleanor
        Bebe
        
   Jeanie married Harry Dresler and had two children.
        Harold 
        Grace
        
   Harry married Elsie Porter and had three children. He was an engineer and a patent attorney.
        Eilene 
        Patricia
        Henry (Tzvi) married Leah Bergman and they have one known daughter. They live in : Philadelphia, PA, where he is an attorney.
            Miriam Hannah
        
   

Some background email from the family can be found here.

I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.
Moishe Millermoishe@langsam.com

My home address is
           1374 East 28th Street
           Brooklyn NY 11210-5311
           USA

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
NARA Ship Arrival Microfilm Roll Numbers 2 January 1892 - 31 December 1924
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
NARA Ship Arrival Microfilm Roll Numbers 2 January 1892 - 31 December 1924




Consult the list below, or go to the source:
For passenger lists between 2 January 1892 and 16-17 June 1897 go to
http://www.nara.gov/publications/microfilm/immigrant/rg36nyk2.html
For passenger lists between 16 June 1897 and 31 December 1924 go to
http://www.nara.gov/publications/microfilm/immigrant/rg85nyk4.html
Find the roll number (M237 or T715) that corresponds to the date that you are looking for.

Searching the Ellis Island Database in One Step (Jewish Passengers) 


Finding Missing Manifests in One Step

Search Emigration Lists of Hamburg 


 The missing rolls are:

And of the remaining rolls (which are not missing), some might have frames missing.

I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.
Moishe Millermoishe@langsam.com

My home address is

http://www.ics.uci.edu/~dan/genealogy/Miller/langsam/lngsmltr.htm
##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
Langsam-Spira Book Contact Letter
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
Langsam-Spira Book Contact Letter



Source found at Dr. Michael M. Cohen website -  http://www.totse.com/en/technology/science_technology/ltrwrite.html on 10/07/2001.


Here is a typical inquiry letter that I and several cousins have
used in contacting Langsams. We got addresses mainly from phonebooks.
For some of the people, we already had partial information.
We made a spanish translation for south america which paid off.
We got something like a 35% response rate. An important point in
such a letter is to provide a lot of info so that the recipient
knows that this is not one of "those ripoffs". Also, important
to include a stamped envelope! BTW any Langsams out there - feel
free to write. MMC  ------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
Dr. Michael M. Cohen
183 Palo Verde Terrace
Santa Cruz, CA 95060
June 4, 1985 

Dear Langsam Cousin, 

 I am representing a group of cousins who are working on a family history
project and we would like to involve you in the project. After a number
of years of research, we have found that most of the Langsams alive today
are related through a man named Pesach Langsam who lived during the last
half of the 18th century in a village in Galicia. The name of the town was
Yawornik (now in Poland). The Austrian government ruled over the area from 1772 until after World War I. Austria insisted that all people under its
rule have last names and so, during Pesach's adulthood, he was apparently
compelled to adopt a last name. Registration was generally handled on a town
by town basis by officials appointed to handle this process. As most of you
know, Langsam means slowly in German. We suspect that Pesach did not move
quickly enough for an impatient official and was consequently dubbed Langsam. 

Although the name of Pesach's wife has been lost, we do know that she was
descended from a long line of distinguished rabbis and scholars through
her mother's family. This is a facinating collection of ancestors that
extends back with certainty to Rabbi Solomon ben Isaac, also known as
Rashi, who lived in Troyes, France in the 11th and 12th centuries. 

We are now compiling a book for family use that outlines our common ances-
toral lines and would be glad to share a copy with anyone who is interested. 
 Meanwhile, back to Pesach and his wife. They had many children but some
died young. We know about 5 of his sons. What we are trying to do is place
as many Langsams as possible with one of those sons or identify other lines
of descent. Please examine the following information carefully and then
answer the enclosed questionaire. We have enclosed a stamped envelope in
this letter for your convienence. __________________________________________________________________________ 

Pesach Langsam of Yavornik b about 1740 +
Niece of Rabbi Elimelech of Lisensk d 1786
__________________________|_________________________________ | | | | |
Shabti David Rabbi Tzvi Elimelech Efraim Shmuel Chaim Lieb
1783-1841 1783-1830 

1) Shabti had at least one son: Avraham Abba, who, in turn had at least
one son, Pesach David from Malczow. This man had the last name of
Miller, probably due to restrictive marriage laws imposed by the 
Austrian government. When a civil marriage did not occur, the children
had to be known by the mother's name and only the eldest son could
legally marry for quite a number of years. However, there is much
evidence that there were also Langsam descendents from this line. 

2) David had a son Pesach, who lived over a hundred years. Pesach married
a cousin from the Spira line and also someone else. His children were
Shimon of Meilitz, Nacha, Sholem of Lancut, Meir of Bircza, and Ita.
We have identified descendents of all these children except Nacha. 
3) Rabbi Tzvi Elimelech (Spira) of Dynow was a famous hasidic rebbe who
took the name Spira. All of Tzvi Elimelech's sons continued using that
name. We know a graet deal about this family. 
4) For Ephriam Shmuel we have identified only one line. He seems to have
had a son Pesach who married Sarah Miriam Tscherlit. They lived in
Blazowa which is a larger town near Yavornik. My great-great grand-
father Chaim Efriam Shmuel, born about 1830 was their son. He married
Miriam Landesman and they had five children, all but one of whom has
descendents in the US. We believe we know about all the descendents
of Chiam Efraim Shmuel, but there may have been other siblings.

5) Chaim Leib 1783-1830 lived in Blazowa and had 3 children: Menachem
Mendel, Mirel,and Yosef Yehuda. Mirel married Yehishua Fish of Dynow.
The Fish family is well documented. The family of Yosef Yehuda still has
many holes for us. We know of 6 children: Asher Zelig who married Roiza
(many descendents in Israel), Efriam (who went to the US, no further
certain knowledge), Nosson Dov Ber (dtr Hannah has descendents in
Israel, dtr Golda, son Tzvi Hirsh of Vienna, and 2 other sons, one of
whom came to US), Berish (son Zalman), Golda, Tzvi Elimelech of Lancut (son Aaron came to US, son Yakov and dtr Miriam have descendents in
Israel).

Menachem Mendel of Bukowsk, 1834-1915 had 13 children and perhaps 2
wives. The children were Avraham of Przemysl, Gittel mar Eleazar Fischel,
Pessia mar Ginsberg, Esther mar Lippe Frank, Jacov Josef of Kanczuga mar
Chaya Sura, Channah Mindel mar Chaim Stern of Bukowsk (children took
Langsam name), Yosef of Bukowsk and Dukla mar Hannah, David mar Beila
Orum, Chaim Leib, Ita mar Josef Roth of Sanok, Hinde mar Areh Leib Fish,
Chaya mar Issac Gottlieb of Pruchnik, and Miriam mar Tuvia Rand of Bukowsk.
 From the five known sons of Pesach Langsam of Yavornik we know of about 1400
descendents. We also have information on a number of other families which we
suspect are connected to Pesach but we lack confirming evidence. Among these
families are: Mendel Langsam mar Sarah both born about 1853 lived at 82
Columbia in 1900 (many descendents in US known), Meilach Langsam of Kanczuga mar Golda, Etka Langsam of Pruchnik, Mayer Langsam of Linsk mar Feiga Suss-
fein, Aaron Langsam of Sanok mar Molly, Mayer Langsam of Sienawa, brothers
Yehoshua Chaim and Shoel Shrager Langsam (many descendents in US), Isaac ben
Saul 1857-1924 mar Gittel 1857-1923 had 8 children (many lawyers and doctors
among descendents in NY area), and quite a few more. So, even if we can not
connect your family immediately to Pesach of Yavornik, we may have consider- able information.

Please return the enclosed questionaire and help us put the rest of
the puzzle pieces together!

Best Wishes,
 
Michael M. Cohen
 
----

Your name: __________________________ Hebrew name: ___________________________

links to the lines discussed in the letter. Don't worry about the artwork!
 _____________________________________________________________________________
 Please tell us something about yourself: marriage, children, employment,
interests, etc. Use the back or a separate sheet if necessary.

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Rivka and Shmuel Lehrer Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Rivka and Shmuel Lehrer Family



 
Shmuel  Lehrer (c.1870 - 1930 [2 Iyar]), son of Yitzchok Yehuda, married Rivka Weinberger (c.1874 - 1936 [24 Av]), daughter of Pesach Moshe and Bracha, and they had seven known children. Rivka was from Bukowsko, Poland and was a descendent of the Bnei Yissoschur, R' Hersh Mylech Spira. Shmuel and Rivka lived in Skelivka (known as Felsztein), Ukraine. This town is close to Przemysl, Poland. It is located in Lvivskoi Oblasti (Oblast) at 49�' and 40�', is 20 km from Samor and 12 km from St. Sambor.

	Roza (Rochel) (18?? - C.1942) married Fischel Weinberger. They only had children after seventeen years of their being married. They lived in Cologne, Germany and perished in the Holocaust.
    Rivka (19?? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Miriam (19?? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Chana (19?? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Yakov (19?? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
    

    Avigdor (c.1893 - 1975) married Chana Kanner from Dembitz. They had nine children and lived in Antwerp. Avigdor was a Bukowsko Chasid and also the gabai tzedaka for Rabbi Meir Baal Hanes charity in Antwerp. His final resting place is on the Mount of Olives in Jerusalem.
    Pesach Moshe (19?? - 19?? [22 Teves])
        Dora married Bunim Gutter and lives in Antwerp, Belgium.
            child, child & child    
        Esther (Apr 24, 1928 - c.1980)  was born in Antwerp. She married Yosef Glikman, son of Shija and Debora (nee Sternfeld) of Sosnowicz, Poland, on June 7, 1949. Both Esther and Yosef were living in Borgerhout when they married. They had three children. Yosef remenbers that his father-in-law, Avigdor, had a cousin Fischel Weinberger of Tel-Aviv. This Fischel was different than his uncle, husband of Roza Lehrer. He was also a cousin.
            Josh, Henny Mandelbaum & Itche    
        Yitzchok Yehuda (? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Zev Aryeh (? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Elchonan (? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Berta (Bracha) married Rabbi Moshe Spiegel and lives in Long Beach, NY. They have four children.
            Naftali, Shmuel,  Henny Wexler & Shushi Frankel    
        Shmuel (? - c.1942 [20 Nissan]) perished in the Holocaust.
        Yuta Shaindel (? - c.1942 [21 Nissan]) perished in the Holocaust.
    

    Yosef (18?? - c.1942) and his family perished in the Holocaust.
    child (19?? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
    

    Nesha (18?? - c.1942) married Heschel Schiff. They lived in Antwerp and had twin girls. The family perished in the Holocaust.
    Tonia (19?? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Berta (19?? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
    

    Surtcha (Sarah) (18?? - c. 1942) married Yosef Diller and lived in Germany. They sent the children to Avigdor in Antwerp in an affort to save them, but they were later deported. The entire family perished in the Holocaust.
    Mary (19?? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Freddy (19?? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Izzy (19?? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
    

    Asher (18?? - ?) married and lived in Cologne, Germany. He had two sons.
    Gabi (1939 - 2001) married Nechama. They lived in Bnei Brak were he was part of the Kollel Chazon Ish. They had six children.
            boy, boy, boy, boy, girl & girl    
        Shmuel (193? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
    

    Shlomo (18?? - ?) married and had one daughter. He perished in the Holocaust.
    Klara is married to a Koleman and lives in Bnei Brak.
    






I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.
Moishe Millermoishe@langsam.com

My home address is
           1374 East 28th Street
           Brooklyn NY 11210-5311
           USA

  
Last updated 10/10/2013

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Yakov Eliezer Reiter Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Yakov Eliezer Reiter Family



 
Yakov Eliezer Reiter married Binah. There are two known children.
Rochel Leah (18?? - 19??) married Naftali Seidenfeld and had 5 known children.
    Sholom (c.1861 - 1939) was married at 13(?) and had 12 children, each of which had 12 children.
            Naftali, Shea, Zelig, Sruel, Tonci, Gittel, Margit, Shaindel, Shlomo, Ilonka, Malya, & Yitzchok Hersh
        Yocheved (18?? - 1???)  married Matis (Ahron Matisyahu) Leiber. They had 7 children and lived in Mukachevo, Ukraine.
            Goldie Ostreicher, Chana, Shaindel, Matel, Gittel, Shlomo & Naftali    
        Shaindel (18?? - 1944 [3 Sivan]) married Yechiel Michel Beinhorn. They had one known son. Shaindel perished in the Holocaust (at Auschwitz).
            Meyer    
        Yeshaya (Shaya) (1859 - 1925 [13 Tishrei])  married Golda Weiszberg, daughter of Yekusiel and Tzirel, of Raszlawitz. They had 2 known children. He lived in Bodgrodkerestur, Hungary.
            Chaje Taube, Iszak, Malia Tzirel Weiszberg, Zseni, Mendel, Shlomo, Yehoshua & Avrohom Menachem (Mendel)    
        Efraim Fishel (Jun 1, 1870 - 19??) was born in Mukachevo, Ukraine. He married Etya Perel Perlmutter, daughter of Yitzchok Isaac Perlmutter and Raizel Uri, in Mukachevo on Mar 4, 1913. They had eight children.
            Chaya Binah Beinhorn, Miriam Susha Rupp, Dovid, Rochel Schonfeld?, Shaindel Deutsch, Yitzchok Isaac, Yechezkel & Shlomo    
    

    Raizel (18?? - 1???) married Yitzchok Isaac Perlmutter and had three known sons and two daughters.
    Dovid Leib (18?? - 1???) married and had two known children.
            Avrohm Abish & Chaya Binah Rosenberg    
        Yisroel Meshullim Fayish (18?? - 1???) married and had one known daughter.
            Yocheved Rosenberg    
        Avrohm Yehoshua Heschel (18?? - 1944 [24 Sivan]) married Rochel Leah and had two known daughters.
            Faiga Rosenfeld & Chaya Bina Linzer    
        Etya Perel married Efraim Fishel Seidenfeld, son of Naftali Seidenfeld and Rochel Leah Uri, in Mukachevo,  on Mar 4, 1913. They had eight children.
            Chaya Binah Beinhorn, Miriam Susha Rupp, Dovid, Rochel Schonfeld?, Shaindel Deutsch, Yitzchok Isaac, Yechezkel & Shlomo    
        Chaya Bina married Mordchai Zev Brand. They had one known daughter.
            Mindel Treitel    
    





I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.

##-----------------TITLE------------------------##
The Nechemia Weinberger Family
##------------------TEXT------------------------##
The Nechemia Weinberger Family



 
Nechemia Weinberger (1863 - 1960), son of Pesach Moshe and Bracha, was born in Dynow, Poland. He married Sara Kelner (1862 - 1938) and lived in the Przemysl area of Galica, Poland. They had seven known children. Around 1900 the family move to Cologne, Germany. Later in life Nechemia moved to Israel and is buried in Bnei Brak.
Leah (Apr 26, 1888 - c.1942) married Yechiel Ksias and had four children. They perished in the Holocaust at Auschwitz.
    Dora 
		(1910 - 1999) married Asher Teitelbaum who lived in Antwerp and had three daughters. Asher perished in the Holocaust. She then married Edek Krulik.
            Bertha Schwarz, Malka Pesach & Bella Mandelbrodt    
        Moshe (Apr 23, 1914 - 1937) died at a very young age in Israel. He drowned in the Kinneret.
        Adele (Mar 06, 1912 - Jan 24, 2000) was born in Cologne, Germany. She emigrated to Israel in 1933. In 1936 she married Arno Arndt and had one child, who died at the age of three. She later remarried, to Dr. Mordechai Hirshorn (1899-1950) who Hebracized his name to Karniel. Mordechai passed away when Adele was pregnant. She named their son after him.
            child & Mordechai 
        Menachem (1915 - 1983) married Dina and had two daughters.
            Sara Brenner & Edna Mutsafi 
    

    Beti (18? - c.1942) married Hirsch Ament and had 4 children, the oldest being twins. They all perished in the Holocaust.
    Clara (19? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Norbert (19? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Dora (19? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Berte (19? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
    

    
	Miriam (1891 - 1925) married her first-cousin Shmuel Weinberger (bother of Fischel Weinberger, the Rabbi of Yad Eliahu in Israel). Miriam died during childbirth. Shmuel subsequently married her sister, Mina.
    David (1925 - 19?) married Menucha and had two daughters.
            Miriam & Ofra
    

    Rivka (c.1898 - c.1942) married Yaacov Recker but did not have any children. They perished in the Holocaust.

    
    Mina (Chana Mindel) (1901 - 1999) married her first-cousin and brother-in-law, Shmuel Weinberger, after her sister's passing. They had two children together. They moved from Cologne to Bnei Berak in l936 with 3 children. Shmuel and Mina were both layed to rest in Bnei Brak.
    Moshe married his cousin, Dora Weissman, and have two children.
            Dr. Judith Lobel & Danni 
        Bracha married Meir Fisher. They live in Ramat Gan, Israel.
    

    Pepi married Israel Weisman and had two children. After her husband's passing she remarried, to a man name Tuvia Holichitz in Israel. She lives in Israel.
    Dora married her cousin, Moshe Weinberger, and have two children.
            Dr. Judith Lobel & Danni 
        Hilda married and had a son. She remarried to Yisroel Baron.
            Ofir 
    

    
	Fischel (? - c.1942) married Roza (Rochel) Lehrer. They only had children after seventeen years of their being married. They lived in Cologne, Germany and perished in the Holocaust.
    Rivka (19?? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Miriam (19?? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Chana (19?? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
        Yakov (19?? - c.1942) perished in the Holocaust.
    






I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.
Moishe Millermoishe@langsam.com

           1374 East 28th Street
